instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: 820820-3437-b strange issue
threads.message:
I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> which takes long to wake up once it has gone to sleep, it just happens when machine is running on battery, with charger plugged in, it wakes up fine.
i have replaced battery, keyboard and io board but it does the same thing.
already reflowed smc at 150, but nothing is changed.
ran asd and sensor vp0r fails when its running on battery power, but passes when magsafe is connected

threads.title: 820820-3437-b strange issue
threads.message:
Check how <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> goes up on battery only; when exit from sleep.
It fails VP0R, or VD0R?
VD0R is related with charger and is not available in battery mode.
The issue is present on high battery level, or low level only?

threads.title: 820820-3437-b strange issue
threads.message: VP0R fails, the battery was around 20ish percent when i ran asd

threads.title: 820820-3437-b strange issue
threads.message:
VP0R can fail if battery is low, because <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is lower.

I was asking if sleep recover issue depends of battery level...

threads.title: 820820-3437-b strange issue
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 42126"]
I was asking if sleep recover issue depends of battery level...[/QUOTE]
Happens with fully charged battery aswell, <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is 3.4 when i open lid and 0 when its closed

threads.title: 820820-3437-b strange issue
threads.message:
Okay, so i checked it throughly and it seems that machine will turn on by battery just once, that means it will only power on when battery is connected after that if i shut down it and try to turn it on, it won't react to power button, it will only turn on if i keep holding power button for 10 to 15 seconds.
i have already replaced <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7150</RESISTOR> and caps on battery line, but nothing is changed so far.

threads.title: 820820-3437-b strange issue
threads.message: Post <SIGNAL>SMC_PBUS_VSENSE</SIGNAL> voltage on battery only; when board started.

threads.title: 820820-3437-b strange issue
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 42265"]Post <SIGNAL>SMC_PBUS_VSENSE</SIGNAL> voltage on battery only; when board started.[/QUOTE]
Its 1.269 volts.
this board had ripped battery connectors and pads for data lines were missing, i have put jumper wires on it and getting around 3.4 volts on both lines, do you think there might be something wrong with those pads?

threads.title: 820820-3437-b strange issue
threads.message:
If battery is not correctly connected on SCL/SDA lines, this is one of the possible results...

Please don't quote an entire message from 5cm above.
